title: Connection Error
body:
having some issues logging into Oceanic. NA and EU seen to work perfectly normally.

Login to Oceanic just times out and says unable to connect to pvp.net.

Anyone else?

I have spent most of the day going through troubleshooting with no result.

Does the same thing on my laptop.

Does the same thing from my neighbours WIFI. (which i asked if I could borrow for a few mins)

replies.body:
The main problem was only the OCE server from my PC. No accounts would work from that PC to OCE. NA was not effected at all.

So after 27 days and constant back and forward from support. Who although responsive didn't really suggest anything at all that I could not google and find.

Sometimes playing around with HYPERV, public VPN's and sometimes random anti-malware and anti-virus will change things if they detect issues inbound from certain places.

I found this article about Windows 10 DHCP and other issues. Which basically says that Winsock and the TCP parameters can get messed up sometimes because windows 10 changes them based on performance and errors.

http://www.sysprobs.com/fixed-windows-10-limited-connectivity-not-getting-ip-from-dhcp

The following command cleans out that catalogue and resets the ipv4 log

netsh winsock reset catalog  (Reset WINSOCK entries to installation defaults)
netsh int ipv4 reset reset.log (Reset IPv4 TCP/IP stack to installation defaults)

In the end my issue is fixed and I didn't see this solution mentioned anywhere for fixing this issue with LOL so hopefully it helps some one.

The documents folder thing has not fixed the problem on my PC.

My laptop works at home.

Running through [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) again.

So turns out I fixed my Laptop (atleast on my work connection)

Flash updated itself early morning on sunday according to my install log. It looks like there is a hard coded link in the launcher for OCE to the "Documents" folder on the C drive rather than using the environment variable which is being passed to flash for some reason. I assume adobe air is involved as well. I don't keep my documents there, I moved the documents folder to a network drive so that I can access them from all my computers and use offline files to sync it.

I set it back to default and lol works again. I moved the documents folder to a different drive and it stopped working again.

I assume it's a bug in the launcher since this was only affecting OCE and not NA or EU. If it was in flash I would expect that it would affect all servers.

I'll test it on my PC when I get home as well.

I assume this is a bug in the launcher and some one should look into it.

Great, now I have a black screen issue on the launcher on my laptop.

I assume they are related

Reinstalling again for the millionth time.

The first login that this occurred on was at [GMT+10],  0904 Sunday 6/12/2015 (event log in LOLclient) shows error connecting to RTMPS port 2099 . The previous log from the day before shows no such errors.

ISPs tested, Internode, Telstra, Vodafone, TPG.

Nothing has changed from the night before when i played normally.

I've been through the troubleshooting articles multiple times. Nothing has any impact.

I have now tried 2 different PCs and my laptop. 3 different adsl routers plus tethering to my phone. 4 different internet connections on different ISPs. and windows 10, windows 8 and windows 7. None of the accounts I have tried seem to work connect to my account on Oceanic. 

The strange thing is that I can log into NA and EU as normal.

The issue is not related to my hardware. The issue appears to be related to a "failed response from the server". Wireshark capturing the outbound data on the ADSL line shows handshaking and encryption and auth all as normal. Then when you would expect traffic to commence. 0 packets received from server.

No other games are affected, Blizzard games, POE, DOTA 2 all seem to work normally.

I am about to check my connection from work. But I expect the same result.

Hey Dreltath,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.
